markdownRemark.excerpt: Terms Spamtrap/honeypot - domain or address that only receives spam addresses (no legit emails) Botnet - machines that have been taken over and the user doesn’t…
markdownRemark.html:
Terms

  • Spamtrap/honeypot - domain or address that only receives spam addresses (no legit emails)
  • Botnet - machines that have been taken over and the user doesn’t support the end goal
  • Showshoe spam - spreading load over many ISPs
  • Phishing/Spear Phishing -
  • RBL - (realtime blackhole list) -
  • Heuristics - you can build a list of rules, example - “subject like xxx” AND “from email like xxxx” AND “no attachment”
  • Bayesian (statistical) -
  • Fingerprinting/Hashing -

Examples

  • 419 phishing - “I’m a prince, send money” etc
  • Canadian Pharmacy - Putting text in html span tags so it isn’t caught by heuristics, created a website that looks legitimate
  • Pump ‘n dump - artificially creating demand for stock and then spammers dump the stock and the value goes down

Tools

  • DIG - DNS records dig mydomain.com mx
  • WHOIS - IP/Domain registration whois google.com
  • Databases
  • Regex
  • Trustedsource.org - based on McAfee data
  • spamhaus.org - reputation data

Techniques

  • Parsing data
  • Grouping - by timestamp, source_ip, subject, URL, etc
  • Aggregation - count distinct values/time
  • Identification of outliers - why may something highly similar be classified differently?
